meanings.definition: The act of fixing limits or boundaries
meanings.sent1: The delimitations of the playground were clearly marked with bright red lines.
meanings.sent2: The delimitations of the property were set by the tall fence surrounding it.
meanings.sent3: The delimitations of the race were so strict that even the fastest runner had to slow down.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity knew no delimitations, flowing freely like a river without banks.
meanings.sent5: The delimitations of the forest were like invisible walls, guiding travelers along safe paths.

meanings.definition: Restrictions or limitations placed on something
meanings.sent1: The delimitations on screen time for kids were set to ensure they had a balanced day.
meanings.sent2: The delimitations on the use of company resources were clearly outlined in the employee handbook.
meanings.sent3: The delimitations on dessert intake seemed to disappear when faced with a delicious cake.
meanings.sent4: His delimitations on social interactions made him seem distant, like a lone island in a vast ocean.
meanings.sent5: The delimitations on her dreams felt like heavy chains, holding back her true potential.
